metadata.Title: CVE-2019-7282 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In NetKit through 0.17, rcp.c in the rcp client allows remote rsh servers to bypass intended access restrictions via the filename of . or an empty filename. The impact is modifying the permissions of the target directory on the client side. This is similar to CVE-2018-20685.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7282` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

rsh-client - 0.17-17ubuntu0.1
rsh-server - 0.17-17ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netkit-rsh package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.17-17ubuntu0.1').
